page.title: 14Weymouth Town Bridge.
page.content: The present{Town Bridge}is the {seventh to be}built.The previous ones were built in{1594,1713,1741,1770,1824 {and}1880.The foundation of the present bridge was laid in April 1929.While the building was going on a temporary bridge was built which allowed people to cross from St.Nicholas Street.The {Duke of York}opened the{new Town {Bridge on 4th July 1930. When the bridge is opened to let{tall {ships}through it causes a lot of inconvenience.Cars have to wait in a {long jam}all along{St.Thomas Street. Sometimes the bridge is open for {repairs}and the only way that people can cross is by a{man rowing people back and forth across the harbour.The {Control Room}is on the{left side}up from St.Thomas Street.When the bridge is about to go up lights flash and a siren goes. -Kirsty Hayward.
